    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class TicTacToe
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    A class modelling a tic-tac-toe (noughts and crosses, Xs and Os) game.
    Version:
    November 22, 2019
    Author:
    Rodrigo Fierro
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • playGame

        public void playGame()
        Plays one game of Tic Tac Toe.

      • print

        public static void print()
        Prints the board to standard out using makeString().

      • makeString

        public static java.lang.String makeString()
        Returns a string representing the current state of the game. This should look like a regular tic tac toe board, and be followed by a message if the game is over that says who won (or indicates a tie).
        Returns:
        String representing the tic tac toe game state

      • makeMove

        public static void makeMove​(int row,
                            int col)
        Updates the back end string array with a new move. Requires the coordinates of the board to play a move.
        Parameters:
        int - row to determine the row on the board to make a move
        int - col to determine the row on the board to make a move

      • updateDisplay

        public static void updateDisplay()
        Update the game display, show players current turn, or the current winner.

      • getPlayer

        public static java.lang.String getPlayer()
        Retuns the string of the player whos turn it is.
        Returns:
        a String of whichever players turn it is.

      • getPlayerXName

        public static java.lang.String getPlayerXName()
        Retuns the string for player X
        Returns:
        a String set to player X's name.

      • getPlayerOName

        public static java.lang.String getPlayerOName()
        Retuns the string for player O
        Returns:
        a String set to player O's name.

      • getWinner

        public static java.lang.String getWinner()
        Retuns the winner string. Empty if game is still in progress
        Returns:
        a String containing the current winner status
